result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Renee Marie Bruce

records.addlTxt: Order for payment on October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
FOR ATTY FEES. DE to pay $50/mo comm 10/15/22. PPF waived. DE signed Pet for Appt of Atty & will be mailed an Order for Pymt. kma
from JA to DE and Atty. Erdman appointing counsel. kma

Cash bond set

-$250.00 Bond on file. 

- Defendant may retrieve personal belongings through duration of tenancy with no abusive contact with Justin W. while retrieving personal belongings.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Justin W.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

9:56 AM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Renee Marie Bruce. Defendant Renee Marie Bruce in court. Court reviews case. Court sets SETC and PSC.  Court Amends bond. Adjourned 10:03 AM
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Settlement conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Settlement conference on October 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on November 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Signed by RMW on 9/19/22. Appointing Atty. Erdman; repayment rate of $50/mo commencing 10/15/22. kma

DE received copy of complaint, confirms address and DOB. DE does not qualify for public defender, PFAC provided. Court sets bond. NG, pre-plea rights preserved. Court sets STC for attorney status.
